channel.title: Bad auto talker im just learning so please dont flame

item.title: Bad auto talker im just learning so please dont flame
item.dc:creator: @hey321 hey321
item.description:
@hey321 wrote:

Slinky use {.include SRL/SRL.scar} and it SHOULD work after you put

SetupSRL;

in your main loop. It will then tell it that srl is setup and that TypeSend works :P. So instead of your mainloop looking like this:

begin
repeat
talking;
until(false)
end

Make it look like this:

begin
SetupSRL;
repeat
talking;
until(false)
end

Read full topic
item.source: Bad auto talker im just learning so please dont flame

item.title: Bad auto talker im just learning so please dont flame
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

This doesn’t work for RuneScape. Try to use SRL. There’s a great procedure called TypeSend. Oh, by the way, you need to add a begin before the repeat, and an end. after the until(false).

Read full topic
item.source: Bad auto talker im just learning so please dont flame

item.title: Bad auto talker im just learning so please dont flame
item.dc:creator: @slinkyman24 slinkyman24
item.description:
@slinkyman24 wrote:

ok this is very bad lol u guyz shouldnt use if you dont like im just learning so please dont flame me and i used a tut for this script.
[scar]program autotalker;

{.include SRL/SRL.scar}

const
message1=‘type your message here’;

procedure talking;
begin
wait(2000)
typesend(message1);
end;

begin
setupsrl;
repeat
talking;
until(false)
end[/scar]

Read full topic
